titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Photographer File
ca. 1882-present
PR 50
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jennifer Lewis, Marybeth Kavanagh, and others

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from photographer.xml

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-07T15:52-0500

did.unittitle: Photographer File
did.physloc: Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections
did.abstract: The collection is a file containing photographs, mainly of New York City, taken by notable photographers including Berenice Abbott; Lilyan Aloma; Joseph Aronberg; Alice Austen; Jim Beecher; Paul Bernius; Emery Reves Biro; Alice Boughton; Margaret Bourke-White; Rudy Burckhardt; Lawrence Cherney; William Cooper; Jeff Cowen; Melody D.Davis; Arnold Eagle; Joyce Edelman; Seymour Edelstein; Charlotte Fairchild; Harold Feinstein; Mark Feldstein; Steven Fenn; Peter Fink; Andrew Garn; Lynn Gilbert; Samuel Gottscho; Keith Gould; Seth Greenwald; Serge Hambourg; Steven Harmon; Ben Heller; Evelyn Hofer; Francis Benjamin Johnston; Raphael Kalmonoff; Karen Kent; Martin Leifer; Gina LeVay; Ann Littlejohn; Janelle Lynch; Danny Lyon; Chris Mackey; Thomas McGovern; Neil Meyerhoff; Alexander Mikhailovich; Peter Nappi; Dinanda Nooney; Clayton Price; Orville Roberts; Laura Rosen; Fred Rosenberg; Thurman Rotan; James Rudnick; Marie Louise Russell; Arthur Sacks; Frederico Savini; Richard Schiffman; Marcia Sheer; Eve Stroh; Joan Vitale Strong; Leon Supraner; Donna Svennevik; Gilles Vauclaire; Wolf Von dem Bussche; Ray Waters; John Wyatt; Paula Wright

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Most of the photographs within the Photographer File were purchased from or donated by the photographers, often for use in exhibitions. Larger gifts include the following: photographs by Alice Austen were a gift of Henry Marion Ward in 1942; Jim Beecher donated his photographs in 1986; Chris Mackey donated her photographs in 1983; Sy Edelstein donated his photographs in 1994; Wolf Von Dem Bussche's photographs were a gift of Mr. and Mrs. Timothy A. Eaton in 1997; Arthur Sacks donated his photographs in 1987; Paula Wright donated her 1964-1965 World's Fair photographs in 1993; 11 photographs by Joyce Edelman were donated by Deborah Edelman in 1992; Charles Schwartz donated photographs by a number of photographers in 2002, and Fred Rosenberg donated his photographs in 2004.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. See guidelines in Print Room for details.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to reproduce any Print Room holdings through publication must be obtained from:
Rights and Reproductions
The New-York Historical Society
Two West 77th Street
New York, NY 10024
Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282
Fax: (212) 579-8794

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as Photographer File, PR 050, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Photographer File is an artificial collection of photographs that have been acquired through donation or purchase from prominent photographers. Photographs in this collection were often acquired in small numbers or for exhibitions at The New-York Historical Society. Some of the photographs in this collection were included in The New-York Historical Society exhibit "Manhattan Now: 14 Photographers Look at the Form of the City" in 1974, or the 1981 exhibit "Manhattan Observed: Fourteen Photographers Look at New York, 1972-1981." The Photographer File has developed over the years as a collection to house photographs of New York, often by well-known New York photographers. While the file consists mostly of work from the 1930s through the present, photographs by some early portrait photographers, such as Alice Boughton, Frances Benjamin Johnson, Charlotte Fairchild, Underwood & Underwood, and William A. Cooper are also included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Photographer File dates primarily from 1930 through the present, but includes a few photographs by prominent photographers from as early as ca. 1882. The finding aid is arranged alphabetically by photographer's name; photographs are housed by size. Because of the varied nature of this collection, the photographs have been described more fully under each photographer's name in the folder listing. Researchers should be aware that in most cases the permission of the photographer is required for reproduction of images.

Included within this collection are photographs by Berenice Abbott; Lilyan Aloma; Joseph Aronberg; Alice Austen; Jim Beecher; Paul Bernius; Emery Reves Biro; Alice Boughton; Margaret Bourke-White; Rudy Burckhardt; Lawrence Cherney; William Cooper; Jeff Cowen; Melody D.Davis; Arnold Eagle; Joyce Edelman; Seymour Edelstein; Charlotte Fairchild; Harold Feinstein; Mark Feldstein; Steven Fenn; Peter Fink; Andrew Garn; Lynn Gilbert; Samuel Gottscho; Keith Gould; Seth Greenwald; Serge Hambourg; Steven Harmon; Ben Heller; Evelyn Hofer; Francis Benjamin Johnston; Raphael Kalmonoff; Karen Kent; Martin Leifer; Gina LeVay; Ann Littlejohn;Janelle Lynch; Danny Lyon; Chris Mackey; Thomas McGovern; Neil Meyerhoff; Alexander Mikhailovich; Peter Nappi; Dinanda Nooney;Clayton Price; Orville Roberts; Laura Rosen; Fred Rosenberg; Thurman Rotan; James Rudnick; Marie Louise Russell; Arthur Sacks; Frederico Savini; Richard Schiffman; Marcia Sheer; Eve Stroh; Joan Vitale Strong; Leon Supraner; Donna Svennevik; Gilles Vauclaire; Wolf Von dem Bussche; Ray Waters; John Wyatt; Paula Wright. Prominent people portrayed in this collection include David Dinkins, Nelson Mandela, Albert Einstein, Doc Cheatham, Henry James, Charles Dana Gibson, Billie Jean King.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The finding aid is organized alphabetically by photographer's name; photographs are housed by size.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs by the following have been removed to their own collections: Ruth Orkin (PR 190), Bill Aron (PR 192), Sidney Kerner (PR 193), Morris Huberland (PR 194), Harold Roth (PR 195), Lewis F. White (PR 196), Rhoda Galyn (PR 197), Robert Gambee (PR 198), Michael George (PR 199), David Sagarin (PR 200), Jan Staller (PR 201), Philip Trager (PR 202), Eadweard Muybridge (PR 205), William F. Winter (PR 206), Andreas Feininger (PR 207), and Bill Cunningham (PR 307).

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: additions processed by archivist Marybeth Kavanagh in 2016 and 2017.

Costume -- United States

did.unittitle: Abbott, Berenice (1898-1991)
1 gelatin silver print, 4 x 6.5 in. mounted on a 14 x 18 mat board. Bird's eye view of Wall Street.
Albok, John
1 gelatin silver print, 8 x 10 in., Wash Day, view of rain falling on Madison Avenue near 96th Street. Signed.
Aloma, Lilyan
1 gelatin silver print, 16 x 20 in., of New York City buildings including a billboard, water tower and one way sign; photograph is entitled "One Way".
Aronberg, Jacob

2 gelatin silver prints, mounted, 3 1/4 x 4 3/4 in. of New York City urban youth. One shows the back window of a school bus with a bullet hole; the other is of a young girl in a sundress jumping rope down an urban sidewalk. Signed, dated and stamped by the photographer.
Austen, Alice (1866-1952)
13 gelatin silver prints, mounted, 4 x 5 in. or smaller, of unidentified boats. (2 folders)
Beecher, Jim
13 gelatin silver prints, 8 x 10 in., taken at the Tompkins Square Boys' Club of New York at 287 E. 10th St. in Manhattan
Beller-Smith, Victoria
"Poor Cat" [7 boys posing with cat]
West 77th Street
Broadway and 71st Street [Nevada Hotel demolition]
[Five kids 110th Street]
11 contact sheets of New York City images [includes off-track betting, lower east side, Harlem, upper west side]
Bernius, Paul

1 mounted gelatin silver print, 13 1/2 x 10 1/2 in., of John Iannuzzi fleeing a fire at 572 President Street in Brooklyn, carrrying his caged parrot, Bobo; photograph is entitled Polly Wanna Cracker, Untoasted. Published newspaper clipping from the Daily News including the photograph is mounted on the verso.
Biro, Emery Reves (1895-1975)

3 color transparencies, 8 x 10 in., 3 gelatin silver portraits, 11 x 14 in. of Biro (self portrait), Charles Dana Gibson, and Paul Lukas(?). 1 tear sheet advertisement, and 2 black and white negatives, 8 x 10 in. of unidentified women. (2 folders)
Boughton, Alice (1865-1943)
3 palladium prints; one 7 3/4 x 4 3/4 in. portrait of Henry James, one 8 1/2 x 6 5/8 in. mounted portrait of Henry James, and one 8 x 10 in. mounted portrait of an unidentified man.
Bourke-White, Margaret (1904-1971)

1 gelatin silver print, 6 3/4 x 4 1/2 in., portrait of S.J. Woolf, artist, signed by Bourke-White and 1 6 1/2 x 9 1/2 inch gelatin silver print of an unidentified boat, bearing the photographer's stamp.
Burckhardt, Rudy (1914-1999)

1 black and white photomechanical print on Japanese tissue paper, 8 1/4 x 6 1/4 in., of a woman walking by the Saks & Co. storefront on 34th Street in 1938, mounted with a poem by Edwin Denby, "Mid Day Crowd".
Cherney, Lawrence
1 color photograph, 11 x 14 in., of S. Klein On the Square.
Cooper, William A
10 gelatin silver prints, 8 x 10 in. and smaller. Unidentified portraits.
Cowen, Jeff
5 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., of transvestite prostitutes on 14th Street in Manhattan.(2 folders)
Davis, Melody D. (1959-)
4 platinum/palladium prints, 12 x 10 in., of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine (Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine).
Eagle, Arnold (1909-1992)

5 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in. or smaller, of New York scenes including a high-angle interior of Pennsylvania Station, young Jews at Torah study, children playing in the street, and interiors of a Second Avenue elevated train station.
Earle, John D

24 gelatin silver prints, 3 1/2" x 4 1/2", taken around 385 Hudson Avenue, Brooklyn, in the 1930s. Photographs are of children, many African American, playing street games, jumping rope and playing ball.
Edelman, Joyce (1945-1991)

4 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., and 7 color photographs, 16 x 20 in., of New York City. Included are street scenes, skylines, aerial views showing East River bridges, and a photograph of the New York County Supreme Court entrance at 60 Centre Street. Portraits of jazz musician Doc Cheatham are included.
Edelstein, Seymour

14 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., from Edelstein's "Shopkeepers" series. Includes portraits of Jewish shopkeepers on the Lower East Side of Manhattan and in Brooklyn. Views of storefronts, signs, and shop interiors are included.
Fairchild, Charlotte
1 gelatin silver print, 11 x 14 in., full length portrait of an unidentified boy and woman in front of exterior (garden?) door.
Feinstein, Harold
7 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in. of street views, a boy writing numbers with chalk on a sidewalk, a man holding a child, and snow on tree branches. All are signed, dated and numbered.
Feldstein, Mark (1937-)
11 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in. of cars and architectural details of Manhattan buildings. Photographs are high-contrast with attention to form and structure.
Fenn, Steven
World Trade Center, Lower Manhattan. Chromogenic print, 16x20 in.
Fink, Peter
1 gelatin silver print, 10 x 6 1/2 in., mounted, of a rippled reflection of an unidentified building. Mount is signed by the photographer.
Frisone, Rosemarie

6 black and white pigment prints, 11 x 14 in., all taken on the Staten Island Ferry: Ferry & Statue of Liberty (going to Staten Island); Terminal Industries; Viewing Statue of Liberty (Window Reflections); Girl with dog; Docking Staten Island Side; Upper Deck (Shoe Shine with trio).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition Note
acqinfo.p: 4 images, Gift of Rosemarie Frisone, 2017; 2 images, purchase, 2017

did.unittitle: Garn, Andrew
5 color photographs, 12 x 12 in., of New York buildings, including the Guggenheim Museum, the Municipal Building, the RCA Building, 500 Fifth Avenue, and the Woolworth Building.
Gescheidt, Alfred
4 gelatin silver prints: ship on wharf, boy on rooftop, icy watertower, firefighting at Lexington Avenue and 31st Street
Gilbert, Lynn

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: Processed by archivist Larry Weimer in October 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes one gelatin silver print, b&w, 14 x 11". Image is of King with tennis racket, seated in a locker room.

did.unittitle: Gottscho, Samuel H.
1 gelatin silver print, 8 1/4 x 11 in., cemetery view on Governors Island. Stamped
Gould, Keith

10 digital color prints, varying sizes, from 13 x 17 1/2 in. to 13 x 19 in. from his series "Subways are for Sleeping." Each print has been numbered to correspond with it's title: 1. "yellow coat," 2. "upper east side," 3. "Michelin man," 4. "nanny," 5. "pulp fiction," 6. "terror guy," 7. "serenity," 8. "yellow scarf," 9. "yankee fan," 10. "the hood."
Greenwald, Seth

4 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., of the George Washington Bridge from below, a woman with flyswatter, a depiction of Jesus hung beside photograph of John F. Kennedy, and girl running beside a fountain. All are signed and numbered.
Hambourg, Serge (1936-)
2 color photographs of a New York subway platform and a subway entrance gate. 1 gelatin silver self-portrait, 8 x 10 in.
1 color photograph, 16 x 20 in., of a subway platform at 34th Street and Seventh Avenue.
Harmon, Stephen F. (1943-)
8 color photographs, 16 x 20 in. New York City street scenes.
10 color photographs, 8 x10 in., New York City street scenes including subway car with graffiti, Flatiron Building, phone booths, pretzel wagon, and an abortion rights demonstration
29 color photographs, 11 x 14 in. Times Square sex shops and movie theaters.
Heller, Ben
1 gelatin silver print, 9 1/4 x 7 1/4 in., of men playing baseball in a lot in the gas house district (East 14th Street). Stamped as an Underwood & Underwood photo by Ben Heller.
Hine, Lewis
Making Violets, New York City. Gelatin silver print, 4 5/8in. x 6 5/8in.
Hofer, Evelyn
1 gelatin silver print, 8 x 10 in., of the World Trade Center under construction.
Jackson, William Henry (1843-1942)
3 albumen photographs, approx. 16 x 20 in., of the Hudson River from various locations in New York State.
Johnston, Frances Benjamin (1864-1952)
1 gelatin silver print, 11 x 13 1/2 in., mounted, of 9 wives of the United States Cabinet, including Mrs. Daniel Scott Lamont(wife of the Secretary of War).
Kalmanoff, Raphael J.
6 toned gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., of the Coney Island Gyroscope and Steeplechase, New York street scenes, and an elevated railroad. All are signed.
Katz, Bruce
City Limits (post Sandy) Orchard Beach, Bronx inkjet print on Hahnmuhle paper 22"x17"
City Limits (post Sandy) Riis Park, Queens inkjet print on Hahnmuhle paper 22"x17"
Kent, Karen
1 color photograph, 11 x 14 in., of the South Street seaport.
Leifer, Martin (1916- )

65 gelatin silver prints, 8 x 10 in. or smaller, straightforward architectural photographs of locations in Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Governors Island, including Coney Island, the Brooklyn Navy Yard, and Governors Island residences. (4 folders)
1 gelatin silver print, 6 x 9 1/2 in., mounted, of St. Paul's Chapel with the Western Union Building.
LeVay, Gina
5 Archival pigment prints of Sandhogs working in City Water Tunnel #3, Manhattan Sect
Littlejohn, Ann
1 color photograph, 11 x 14 in., of New York Mayor David Dinkins.
Lyon, Danny (1942-)
1 gelatin silver print, 7 1/2 x 7 1/2 in., of the interior of 88 Gold Street. [Plate 33 from the book "The Destruction of Lower Manhattan" (1969).] Signed, stamped, numbered, and dated on the verso.
Mackey, Chris
27 gelatin silver prints, 7 x 10 in., of street scenes and shop windows on the Lower East Side of Manhattan, primarily on Ludlow and Orchard Streets. (2 folders)
McGovern, Thomas
2 black and white prints of tattoo artist Mike Bakaty and his clients at his studio at 295 Bowery.
Merrill, Larry
Bethesda Terra [bride being photographed] (chromogenic print from film negative)
Madison Avenue (digital print on cotton rag paper using pigmented ink)
Meyer, William
1 gelatin silver print, Hunts Point Market, Bronx
Meyerhoff, Neil (1949-)
5 color photographs, 11 x 14 in., of New York street life, often with reflections in shop windows.
Mikhailovich, Alexander
1 gelatin silver print, 8 1/2 x 5 1/2 in., is a self portrait. 16 photomechanical views, 5 x 7 in., of New York City, including aerial views.

1 double-sided photomechanical print of the Flatiron Building, hand-colored, 11 x 14 in. 1 color photograph, 16 x 20 in., of Times Square. 2 silver gelatin prints, 16 x 20 in. of New York street scenes. 2 photographic reproduction posters, 16 x 20 in., of the Manhattan skyline and an aerial view of midtown Manhattan.
Nappi, Peter
10 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in. of landscapes and buildings; most depict rural scenes and ruins. All are unidentified.
Nooney, Dinanda
20 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., primarily rooftop views of the West Side Highway and the Hudson River; includes a snow view.
Plasse, Jon

3 gelatin silver photographs, 20 x24 in., from his series"Stadium Memories." Images document Yankee Stadium, showing the field and stands, the stadium exterior and elevated train station, and a mural with famous ballplayers and graffiti.
Price, Clayton

9 color inkjet prints of 21st century subway tunnel construction: "7 Line Tunnel inspection," "2nd Avenue Tunnel," "Workers Travel UnderGrand Central Station," "2nd Avenue Tunnel Area," "Boring Machine," "7 Line 11th Avenue Station Construction," "7 Line Extension," "Under Grand Central Metro North Station," "MTA Tunnel Drilling Rig"
Ratner, Ken (1953- )

12 gelatin silver prints: "Fire Escapes, 17th Street New York," "Chrysler Building in a Puddle," "Warren Building, 20th Street and Broadway," "Guggenheim Museum, #1," "Crown Building at Night," "Window Cleaners Through Glass Reflection, 45th Street," "Window Cleaner Over 45th Street," "Shapes and Shadows, New York," "Tribute to Derek Jeter in his Final Yankees Season, 34th Street," "Shadows on Broadway," "New Utrecht Avenue, Borough Park," "Relic of the Lower East Side"
Robertson, Orville (1959-)
3 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., of New York street scenes, particularly advertisements and signs. Titled, signed and dated by the photographer.
Rosen, Laura

1 cibachrome color prints and 5 silver gelatin prints, all 11 x 14 in., all views of or from NYC rooftops, printed for the 2001 N-YHS "Rooftops" exhibition. Views include The Yale Truck billboard and roof gardens with people sunbathing.

1 cibachrome color print and 1 silver gelatin prints, both 16 x 20 in., printed for the 2001 N-YHS "Rooftops" exhibition. Photos show joggers on the roof of the McGraw Hill building, and the roof of the AT&T building, with a view of the World Trade Center.
Rosenberg, Fred
15 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., of Manhattan residents and street scenes at night, from the photographer's series "Night Gallery".
Rosenblum, Walter (1919-2006)
Block Party, Pitt Street, New York (4 gelatin silver photographs)
Rothschild, Amalie
Grateful Dead Concert at the Fillmore East (3 photos)
Rudnick, James
3 color prints, 11 x 14, of the Statue of Liberty renovation and cleaning. Prints made by the photographer in 2004 from his negatives. All are signed by the photographer.
Russell, Marie Louise
54 gelatin silver prints of New York City, various sizes, including industrial sites and harbor scenes -- unusual subject matter for a woman photographer of this era (2 folders).
Sacks, Arthur
10 gelatin silver prints, 16 x 15 in., of the 72nd Street train yards in Manhattan. (3 folders)
Savini, Federico
3 color prints of the Hua Mei Bird Garden in Chinatown, including views of birds and bird cages, exhibited in the 2003 N-YHS exhibition "Petropolis."
Schiffman, Richard (1952-)

2 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., one of First Calvary Cemetery in Long Island City, Queens, with the Manhattan skyline in the background, and one of the Manhattan skyline from the Queens riverfront.
Sheer, Marcia (1916-1989)
2 cyanotypes and 3 sepia toned gelatin silver prints, 9 x 11 1/2 in. Park views, signed and labeled on verso in pencil.
Squillante, Joseph
Kaaterskill Falls [Hudson River Portfolio]
L'il Red Lightouse from Sloop Clearwater [Hudson River Portfolio]
Sunnyside, Home of Washington Irving [Hudson River Portfolio][color print]
View from the World Trade Center
Stein, Harvey
1 gelatin silver print, 11 x 14 in. Man Wearing Bow Tie, Coney Island.
Stroh, Eve (1917-)

12 modern gelatin silver prints, 8 x 10 in., from negatives taken in the 1960s of the Essex Street market preparing for the festival of Sukkot, the demolition of the 8th Regiment Armory on 94th Street, the demolition of Pennsylvania Station, and a few views of the 1964-1965 New York World's Fair. (All were printed by Wayne Goldstein in 1983).
Strong, Joan Vitale
2 color photographs, 11 x 14 in., portraits of Nelson Mandela taken during his 1990 trip to New York.
Supraner, Leon (1925-)
23 gelatin silver prints: 1 - 8 x 10 in., 7 - 11 x 14 in., 15 - 20 x 24 in. Structurally focused views of Manhattan architecture. One is an unattributed (self?) portrait of Supraner.
Svennevik, Donna
2 color photographs, one 8 x 10 in. and one 11 x 14 in., of New York street scenes, with green and blue stripes painted on pavement by artist Eric Arctander.
Underwood & Underwood (est. 1882)
22 gelatin silver prints, 4 x 5 inches and smaller. Unidentified New York street scenes.
Vauclair, Gilles

20 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in., of New York street scenes and structures, including the Manhattan Bridge from below, Wall Street, the Pan Am Building and Grand Central Terminal, the World Trade Center, and the Woolworth Building. Also includes a view of 42nd Street and Lexington Avenue in a snow storm. Two prints from Queens: a view of snow-covered elevated train tracks north from the Astoria Boulevard station to the Ditmars Boulevard terminal in Queens and of the number 7 subway train descending into the Queensboro Plaza station, Swingline Staplers sign visible in the distance.
Van Loen, Alfred (attributed)
[Young boy embracing Alice in Wonderland sculpture in Central Park]

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Includes sketch and inscription on back

did.unittitle: Von Dem Bussche, Wolf

10 gelatin silver prints, 16 x 20 in. Views of New York, including the World Trade Center, Washington Square, the Flatiron Building, and Foley Square housed in a custom-made metal box. Entitled "N.Y., N.Y. Ten Photographs."
Wampler, Damien
Darfur in Brooklyn [Coney Island Avenue]
Waters, Ray

1 gelatin silver print, 10 1/2 x 13 1/2 in., mounted, of Bernard M. Baruch sitting on his favorite Central Park Bench, as a boy reads the plaque dedicating the bench to Baruch. A "Daily News" clipping of the published photograph is mounted to the verso.
Wright, Paula

14 gelatin silver prints, 11 x 14 in. and smaller. Portraits of children, pets, Albert Einstein (1946), and a self portrait. Other photographs include cows moving across the Hungarian countryside, Mexican men gathered on a stoop, and elderly farmer and his wife in the Adirondack Mountains. All are signed or initialed.

2 gelatin silver prints, 10 1/2 x 13 1/2 in., mounted, of New York street life. One portrays children playing street games in Harlem; the other portrays a barefoot man sleeping on a bench, covered with a newspaper with World War II headlines. Both are signed and dated by the photographer.
15 color slides, 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in., of the 1964-1965 New York World's Fair including lights, people, structures and fountains.
Wyatt, John
3 black and white prints of tattoo artist Thom de Vita and his clients at his studio at 326 East 4th Street.
Yankus, Marc
San Remo (pigment print)
PK [snowy rooftops] (pigment print)
Zimbel, George (1929-)
"A Day in Bedford Stuyvesant Brooklyn, 1968" (12 photos)
Unidentified

Images include architectural ornaments, birds on tree, motorcycles, beach with view of Statue of Liberty, trash on beach, elevated subway station with rooftops, mowing lawn in Central Park, aerial view of parade, and others

Images include World Trade Center; Flushing, Queens; cable cars to Roosevelt Island; boats on the East River; High Bridge; South Street Seaport Museum; New York Botanical Garden; excavation site; aerial view of Manhattan; jockey in horse race; Bi-centennial Tall Ships Parade?; street scene with Hispanics; trash; Central Park; water tanks; beach scenes; and others
